item.title: [SOLVED]Creating a Distributed client?[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

ooh i see, I had to change org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient to org.darkquest.client.mudclient, and add defs.jar to the .bat, and it works thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED]Creating a Distributed client?[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

You need, Conf folder - “data folder”, Lib folder with your “library” files, your settngs.ini wth your correct client settings in also your jar file, and lastly run.bat(???.bat whatever you want) and edit the .bat wth notepad copy and paste ths into the .bat

@echo off
java -classpath Evolution.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/xpp3.jar; org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient
pause

Rename “evolution.jar” to whatever your jar file name is “fearnuture.jar” for example. Save and run the .bat

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED]Creating a Distributed client?[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:2, topic:434655”][quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=537373.msg3929271#msg3929271 date=1330532504]
what files do I need?
I’m using darkquest source and client.
[/quote]

You’d need the folder for handling .rscd files, the lib folder, maybe a folder for the screenshots handling, you’re jar file, and anything else peteer might of added e.g some sort of settings file.

and a run.bat client which is pretty obvious[/quote]

Thanks for responding so quickly.
my Data folder holds all the .rscd files, config.properties. I’ve got the lib folder, got the jar file, and i got the .bat. does the .bat ant runclient or does it run the .jar?

Read full topic

@waj wrote:

You’d need the folder for handling .rscd files, the lib folder, maybe a folder for the screenshots handling, you’re jar file, and anything else peteer might of added e.g some sort of settings file.

and a run.bat client which is pretty obvious
